intro: Knautia cupularis, commonly known as the cupular knautia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright stems covered with soft, hairy foliage. Its flowers are typically pink to purple, arranged in dense, spherical clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
